Methamphetamine

Drug Testing

SUMMARY #


                    Context:

                    Text: 
                    New, Vintage, and Signed Blotter Art

Contribute $50 or more and get a piece of displayable blotter art. These look great framed on the wall !

Methamphetamine

Drug Testing

by Erowid

SUMMARY #

U.S. DRUG TESTING SUMMARY Methamphetamine Tested for in Standard Drug Tests ? YES Tested for in Extended Drug Tests ? YES Possible to Test for? YES Detection Period in Urine 3-6 days

TEST TYPES #

Urine Testing

Amphetamines are one of the "SAMHSA-5". The five drugs tested for in the standard NIDA approved drug test. Amphetamines are standardly detectable in urine for 1-3 days after use. Methamphetamines stay in the system slightly longer, 3-5 days.

Test Information


                    Context: 
                    This section provides detailed information on methamphetamine drug testing methods, detection periods in urine, blood, and hair, potential false positives, and disclaimers. It is a specific subset of the broader drugs and chemicals information covered on the webpage, relevant for understanding drug detection and testing protocols.

metadata.title: Erowid Methamphetamine Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about methamphetamine in drug tests.

content:
Drug: Methamphetamine | cid: 10836
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about methamphetamine in drug tests.
Erowid name: meth
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    Test Information

The Amphetamine test is a one step competitive immunoassay that is used to screen for the presence of amphetamine in urine. It is a chromatographic absorbent device in which drug or drug metabolites in a sample compete with drug conjugate immobilized on a porous membrane for a limited number of binding sites. This test is a rapid, qualitative immunoassay for the detection of amphetamine in urine. The cutoff concentration for this test is 1000 ng/ml, as recommended by the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration and NIDA." The cutoff for GC-MS, which detects d-amphetamine and methamphetamine, is 500 ng/ml.

Hair Testing


                    Context: 
                    This section provides detailed information about drug testing methods for amphetamines, including urine and hair tests, detection periods, and cutoff levels, crucial for understanding how methamphetamine can be identified in various testing scenarios within the broader context of drug testing and psychoactive substance regulation.

metadata.title: Erowid Methamphetamine Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about methamphetamine in drug tests.

content:
Drug: Methamphetamine | cid: 10836
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about methamphetamine in drug tests.
Erowid name: meth
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    Hair Testing

Methamphetamine is detectable with hair tests and is included in the standard set of substances tested for with these tests. Hair tests generally take the most recent 1.5 inches of growth and use those for testing. That provides a detection period of approximately 90 days. If an individual's hair is shorter than 1.5 inches, this detection period will be shorter.

Blood Testing

Methamphetamine is detectable in blood for 1-3 days. Levels over 100 ng/ml are considered consistent with abuse.

FALSE POSITIVES #

Substances or Conditions which can cause false positives


                    Context: 
                    This section summarizes methamphetamine detection methods in hair and blood tests, including detection periods and false positive causes. It provides crucial testing timeframe details and factors influencing accuracy, aiding understanding of drug testing protocols within the broader drug information resource.

metadata.title: Erowid Methamphetamine Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about methamphetamine in drug tests.

content:
Drug: Methamphetamine | cid: 10836
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about methamphetamine in drug tests.
Erowid name: meth
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    FALSE POSITIVES #

Substances or Conditions which can cause false positives

Ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, propylephedrine, phenylephrine, or desoxyephedrine (Nyquil, Contact, Sudafed, Allerest, Tavist-D, Dimetapp, etc) Phenegan-D, Robitussin Cold and Flu, Vicks Nyquil Over-the-counter diet aids with phenylpropanolamine (Dexatrim, Accutrim) Over-the-counter nasal sprays (Vicks inhaler, Afrin) Asthma medications (Marax, Bronkaid tablets, Primatine Tablets) Prescription medications (Amfepramone, Cathne, Etafediabe, Morazone, ...phendimetrazine, phenmetrazine, benzphetamine, fenfluramine, dexfenfluramine, ...dexdenfluramine,Redux, mephentermine, Mesocarb, methoxyphenamine, phentermine, ... amineptine, Pholedrine, hydroymethamphetamine, Dexedrine, amifepramone, clobenzorex, ...fenproyorex, mefenorex, fenelylline, Didrex, dextroamphetamine, methphenidate, Ritalin, ...pemoline, Cylert, selegiline, Deprenyl, Eldepryl, Famprofazone) Kidney infection, kidney disease Liver disease, diabetes


                    Context: 
                    This section details substances and conditions that can cause false positives in drug testing, specifically for methamphetamine. It provides a comprehensive list of common OTC medications, prescription drugs, and medical conditions that may interfere with test accuracy. This information is crucial for understanding potential limitations and ensuring accurate interpretation of drug test results within the broader context of the webpage's drug testing and substance information.

metadata.title: Erowid Methamphetamine Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about methamphetamine in drug tests.

content:
Drug: Methamphetamine | cid: 10836
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about methamphetamine in drug tests.
Erowid name: meth
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid's drug testing information is a summary of data gathered from site visitors, journal articles, websites, and other resources. Detection periods depend on amount and frequency of use, metabolic rate, body mass, age, overall health, drug tolerance, and urine pH of each individual. Many substances that are not tested for in basic or extended urinalysis tests CAN be tested for by a laboratory willing to go to the trouble, although that is uncommon.

RELATED RESOURCES #

RELATED LINKS #

                    Context: 
                    This chunk contains the "CAUTION & DISCLAIMER" section from the Erowid drug testing information page, highlighting factors affecting detection periods and warning that some substances may be tested for with specialized tests. It is relevant within the broader document addressing drug testing methods, detection windows, and limitations, providing essential caveats for interpreting test results.
